alert.note: Alert for Maury (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 4:57AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following county, Maury. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 456 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended across Maury County. However, radar estimates up to 7 inches of rain has fallen across the area since yesterday evening. Minor flooding will likely continue until waters recede later this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Spring Hill, Mount Pleasant and I-65 East Of Columbia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
